page.title: 05THE MILL HOUSE
page.content: Charlotte Fagg, a pupil at Hollingbourne School. Great grandfather took over the mill as miller in 1906 and kept the mill in full running order for 44 years until it broke down beyond repair, but they still lived at the mill until 1951. In 1914 my grandmother was born and named Iris because her eyes were as blue as the iris that was growing beside the mill stream. She is still living in the village. The pond very often used to empty due to the constant use of the mill and therefore was kept very clean. The pond used to be filled naturally by a spring running underground from the Downs. The mill was mentioned in the Domesday Book and it is said that monks used to fish in the pond.
